poem:
Title: "Offerings and Omissions"

Pews creak under this ancient lie,
Grubby gold, taint of sugar on every shilling. 
Brilliant stain seeping through centuries,
Stoic stone sullied by tried refusal. 
Silence births heavy echoes, remorse winds lost -
Oh Free Church, bathed in shadows of Dixie dollars,
Will truth be uttered in humble tongues wavered?
In forgiveness, is the worth not the reparations, but revelations?
